website_summaries.verdict: A simple stepping machine that's made for low intensity workouts.
pros: Quiet and demands very little space in use and in storage
Decent resistance and a unique "twisting" motion for solid lower body workout
cons: Larger users may find it very unsteady

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the beginning of January 2017, and today it broke (May2017). The tension cord snapped. I'm 5'7", 150lbs, so not likely due to my weight. Also when you raise tension, The calorie counter does not take that into account. Additionally there's no way to enter your weight and have a calculate it thoroughly. I would say it's just a random guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 65yo woman and bought this to strengthen my legs and knees. I love it! It is small and compact enough to stand in my bedroom. It was easy for me to assemble, had it up and running in about 15 minutes. I use it several times per day and even on the weakest setting is challenging but I expect to be able to increase the tension soon. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jaebea

customer_reviews.title: You can't get any better than this......
customer_reviews.text: You can't get any better than this. It's sturdy, compact and does its job as good or better than one of those fancy stair steppers costing 10X what this did, $70. I highly recommend it if you're just looking for a good leg/bottom workout. And for all the reviews saying it is difficult to assemble, my 12 yr old put mine together!
customer_reviews.author: Richele R

customer_reviews.title: Came fast and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son! Came fast and easy set up! He loves it !! It can be adjusted for height
customer_reviews.author: TemperNature

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. I was skeptical about the low price but the quality is there for sure. I put it together easily and alone. It's very quiet so I use it in front of the TV. I'm almost too 1,000 steps with zero issues. The handle is sturdy enough to keep you balanced and the computer works great. Bonus: I've been dealing with a non-arthritis pain in one knee and it is all but gone. This stepper builds muscle strength without stressing the joints.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2 years. It provides a tough workout, is still in good condition, takes very little space, but looks simple. If you can manage to spend 30 min continuously with a tight setting and 50 step count per minute, it is as good as any other exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Sridhar Turaga

customer_reviews.title: I'm a bit over 200lbs and no awkward or insecure feeling like it wont hold me
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier then expected based on other reviews. I'm a bit over 200lbs and no awkward or insecure feeling like it wont hold me. Welds look ok, you can see they are done by hand not robot. Pretty much silent operation. I can lift it one handed to put it to the side when not in use. Tubing gauge is sufficient for decent life expectancy and durability. Overall better then I expected for the price. I recommend for the average user that is making an effort and trying to find an affordable option. If your a fitness nut and use gym membership quality exercise equipment already it might not be exactly what you are wanting.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great mini stepper if you don't have the extra space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stepper because the other stepper that I had broke within a week of use(Not this stepper btw). The handles are great. I've used it for a week now at least 45 minutes each time and I've burned 500+ calories each time. It's a great workout! The assembly for the monitor was a little hard to figure out in the beginning but I found a video on YouTube that helped. Bought the 2 year protection plan just in case something happens, but great piece of equipment if you don't have a lot of room in your place for a bigger piece of equipment. Will be looking at other products from Sunny Health & Fitness for possible future purchases
customer_reviews.author: Chris Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Good stepper!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this stepper and I must say that I am impressed with it. I would recommend you use an actual Screwdriver T tool instead of the one provided to get all the screws nice and tight. I wish it would go a little higher with the steps, but it feels sturdy ad well made. It was simple to set up, I was up and stepping in 10 minutes. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a stair stepper.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V

customer_reviews.title: Not good for apartment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this stepper and loved it...for the 20 minutes I was able to use it. As a New Yorker in Quarantine, I purchased this to as an easy way to make up for the day-to-day walking I’d be missing out on. It’s easy to assemble and quiet for the most part. However, it was manufactured in a way where it’s slightly unlevel that causes a thudding vibration on the floor—my neighbor 2 floors down even complained. If you’re on the first floor or in a house buy it! If not, pass on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect low impact exercise for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Perfect low impact exercise for all ages. My kids hop on all the time while they watch tv and get a good workout. My parents (65 yrs old) tried it out and bought one as well. You can adjust the tension which is a great option for all levels of users. Would recommend for those people who need something compact, easy-to-use, and not super strenuous.
customer_reviews.author: I_heart_amazon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material, no power.
customer_reviews.text: This product is another example of cheap Chinese material. Took me two hours to get the screws in because holes were not at the right place. Wasted two hours of my life for this cheap whatever you wannna call it. This thing has no power at all, but yea if you want to put your new born baby on this, it might work, not guaranteed though. Very pissed. Sellers oughta be ashamed of themselves! I will not recommend if you’re looking for serious burn out.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stair stepper. Easy to put together, not heavy to move. I had the stair stepper with the rubber bands and no handles. It broke and it was hard to keep balance. I recommend this unit with the handles, much better workout. Thighs are getting in shape wu hoo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Price has gone up significantly
customer_reviews.text: I've bought three of these over the years. Two have broken just have the one-year mark. I use it for 30-60 minutes per day so that didn't really bother me too much. The last one I bought didn't even last four months. It should still be under warranty so I'm waiting to hear back from Sunny Fitness. It's great for a workout and definitely builds muscle. Don't pay attention to the data , the step counter is way off and has been on every machine I've had. Too bad with the pandemic, they've raised the price so high. I bough a less-expensive model this time, hoping it lasts longer than four months.
customer_reviews.author: yrusmilin2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, delivered super quick, be careful with a black cable, thought it was part of the packaging and cut it by mistake but I was able to repair it. works good so far, resistance only worth it on the highest level. Good for the price :) Can be stored in a closet
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to figure out assembly. Feels more heavy duty than I expected. Footpads are nice. I wear a size ten but the slippers in the pic are 11. Feels like the perfect range of motion and tension for me (I'm 5'11). How long she holds up is the only thing I can't answer yet. But it seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Walking up and down the stairs is a better workout.
customer_reviews.text: I like to keep moving so I bought this hoping it would be small enough to leave in my living room to use while watching tv or whatever. The range of motion is barely half of a step and the resistance was very poor. I tested it before I had it fully set up and knew immediately it was not what I was looking for So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: DON'T FOCUS TOO MUCH ON THE INSTRUCTION BOOKLET
customer_reviews.text: This is one Kool😎 piece of equipment to add to my In-Home Gym. So far, I am satisfied. However, I do have one (1) minor -Even though I CAN adjust the bar height, I CANNOT adjust the hydraulic lift range. But I'm happy just to be moving due to being quarantined for months. TIP: The instructions will drive you crazy as a Betsy Bug. So don't let the Diagram scare you. Its comes PRE-ASSEMBLED which makes the remaining assembly SUPER easy and quick (Only 5pcs. to assemble) ENJOY❗😊
customer_reviews.author: FlowerBiscuit

customer_reviews.title: Compact small machine but range of motion is limited
customer_reviews.text: This step machine is good for those who is tight on space and doesn't take up much space in your room, which was what I liked about it. The pedals will fit most people's feet sizes, however the range of motion is pretty limited and as someone who is on the light weight side, even the lowest resistance was too much for me, as I usually set the level to quite low at the gym. Therefore, I don't use this as much as I would like to. Is there any way to fix this at all to make it not resistant at all? Or am I just doing it wrong?
customer_reviews.author: thescarletterosedc

customer_reviews.title: Get a good workout with a low profile economical mini-machine
customer_reviews.text: Look ,like most humans I'm lazy. That's why most of us are not in great shape.I know you have to move to feel good.This stepper lets me get a decent workout while watching TV under a fan and ac. It's easy to move,takes up only a bit of space and seems pretty sturdy for the money. You set your own pace and results are entirely up to you and your level of commitment,now excuse me while I become a Greek god.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and good work-out
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the stepper for almost a month. It was easy to assemble, 30-45 minutes, as I recall. Like other reviewers, I found it started squeaking in a day or two. The instruction book recommends slightly dis-assembling the tension cable to lubricate. I didn't dis-assemble it; I just sprayed the area with "liquid wrench" and wiped away the run-off. The squeaking stopped and hasn't returned. The highest tension setting provides a good work-out. I need small exercise equipment for the small house I live in in northern-ish Europe where we have short, cold days in the winter and sometimes I can't get to the gym because of snow or ice.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I received this exactly one month ago and it has already broken twice. I had previously purchased this machine about 3 years ago, but the welding snapped about a month and a half ago, which at this price point and fairly consistent use, fine. I ordered a new one and it lasted about two weeks before the cord snapped. Luckily the cord from the old machine was still intact so I replaced it with that one. Today, the welding snapped on the new one. I've used it maybe 15 times. A piece of junk. Spend the extra money and buy a quality piece so you aren't stuck at home in quarantine with nothing, like I am!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for - I'm content
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small studio apartment and this is quite compact. I like having the handlebars to help me keep my balance. It does squeak a little, but I watch TV while I use it (need the distraction, as I find it quite challenging), so I don't really hear it much. It isn't fancy, but I can work up a quick sweat. I would like to be able to do it for longer periods of time, but I find it quite difficult, despite all the other fitness that I do. This is just a quick way to add a bit more quick cardio in my pretty full routine.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Heart Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (I am an 81 yr old lady). Had only one question, which was answered quickly on the phone. BTW, the name indicates "twister stepper" but there is NO twisting, just simple softened-impact (hydrolic?) steps (while watching tv). Keeps my body happy & healthy! So glad I found this product. Thank you to both Amazon and the brand "Sunny Health and Fitness".
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Warranty?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product last july 24 2018, used this 3x weekly average of 1 hr but after more than a year the left support tube broke down. I reached out to amazon and Sunny Health and Fitness support team and I was very happi with the customer support. Not only that they were very knowledgeable but also helpful. I was told that my stepper was out of warranty but nevertheless I received a Xmas present from the support team. It was a brandnew unit free of charge. Thanks to Sunny Health and Fitness team specially to Brian A.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: good exercise machine
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easily adjustable for abilities. Definitely needs wider base as I have to hold it for my wife who has limited ability to get on by herself, and while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: When my gym closed I realized I need something to take up the slack before I gained twenty pounds. This nifty little stair stepper fits the bill. I have small quarters and this product is slim and lifts easily. This guy squeaks periodically but it is adjustable and super stable for its size. Plus, it hides behind a chair until I use it. It is not a replacement for the elliptical I used at the gym but I did not want, nor could I afford a big hunk of machinery. I really need steps and cardio. This was a great choice for me and gets my heart rate up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Loved it but customer service let me down
customer_reviews.text: I saw everyone say you will need to get replacement parts, so when the cord broke after 5 months, I wrote to customer service. At first, they responded, very helpful. But they asked me to find a number I couldn't find, so I asked how I can find it. I've now emailed 6 times and no further response. I guess they don't intend on servicing their product even though they know it breaks quickly. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: thickness_of_books

customer_reviews.title: Odometer needed to be replaced, stepper is adequate.
customer_reviews.text: The meter does NOT work. It gets to 4 seconds and 1 step then says Stop. Every time. Even after resetting it. Even after I tried my own fresh batteries. The stepper itself is ok. The steps are pretty shallow and you can't go very quickly like you could on an elliptical, but it does give a good workout at a slower pace. It is sturdy. Filled out customer service form. Sent new monitor but machine needs to be taken apart and reassembled again. After about 7-8 minutes, resistance significantly lower. Not a very effective workout.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price paid (under $80) I am quite satisfied. I do think this piece of gear would be best for beginners or near beginners--as others have noted it doesn't have a terrific range of motion (no high knee kicks)--but it is a perfectly good workout. Assembly would be a snap without the electronic counter. With it, there is a convoluted method of feeding the wire from base to meter. Nothing that should dissuade a purchase, though.
customer_reviews.author: nyctc7

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to home gym
customer_reviews.text: I have a little home gym with a recumbent bike and a Total Gym, but needed something to exercise on while standing, rather than laying or sitting...but no room for a treadmill. I saw the reviews on this and decided to give it a try. I was able to out it together myself with out help of hubby (boy was he surprised) and it works great! I am 5'1 and perfect for me. Hubby is 6' and he thought it may be a tad short for him. But he uses professional grade equipment in a gym...so. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: It was not difficult to assemble until I got to the part where I have to attach the pulley. The cable was too short and it won’t fit. I tried very very hard to make it work I spent almost 2 hours just trying to make it fit but didn’t work. I will be returning this unless I get a longer cable from the manufacturer. Update: After a couple of hours of tinkering around with the cable, pulley, and manipulating the stepper, hallelujah, the cable finally worked! I have to say it was worth the time. Used the stepper this morning and within 5 minutes on the stepper, I got a good cardio workout! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Just ok range of motion, mine came with a defect
customer_reviews.text: This stair stepper is cheap, but it works as good as you'd expect. small range of motion that is not super adjustable (not enough to make a difference). Two of the screws on mine didn't have the ability to be screwed in due to the track of the screw not being drilled into the bar so mine is a bit more unsteady. It's decent, but I wish there was more of an ability to get a stronger resistance and a better workout. Assembly was easy, despite the defects, not sure if I'll keep yet
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Much sturdier than anticipated, took me about 20 minutes to assemble - everything you need is included. Mostly the time was just making sure I was putting parts together right per the pictures. Counter works nicely, not too heavy to move around, and adjustable. It is harder than the machine I used at the gym - maybe because of the twisting. But I found as I continued to use I got better at it. Will edit if it ends up squeeking...and if I was able to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobblefrog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the right people
customer_reviews.text: Really solid product. Very heavy duty- will last forever. Great for bigger people because higher rated. Smaller than elliptical which is a plus. I ended up not putting on the handlebar/pole. Didnt need it and made it easier to store. I'd recommend this piece for people who are over the normal 220 capacity for most machines and people who need the bar for support. Otherwise, you can get a cheaper ones without the handle bars. But if you want a stepper that will last or you're heavier and need stability, I'd totally recommend this one. Very easy on the knees and I've noticed the difference in my strength and stamina climbing stairs after using this so I know it works.
customer_reviews.author: M. Waffles

customer_reviews.title: Very happy! Love moving it around the house
customer_reviews.text: Greetings from quarantine! I got this to stay healthy during the quarantine of 2020 and I am very happy with it. It feels so sturdy and provides a nice workout. My favorite thing is that its small and light enough that I can actually move it from room to room depending where I want to use it, even up and down the stairs. And yet it feels extremely strong. I hate exercise but I find myself jumping on this thing frequently just to break up the day and get a quick workout in. I didn't assemble it, my very handy fiancé did, so I can't speak on that but he said it was easy. I think it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stepper
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this devise for almost 3 years. It's a good, sturdy machine. My only wish is that it had more resistance. The moving parts have to be occasionally lubricated with silicon lubricant to prevent squeaking. Customer service is good. I had to replace some parts and the process was easy, and the parts are reasonably priced. I definitely recommend this machine and the company Sunny Health & Fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: The handle makes all the difference to wanting to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Great thing to do while watching TV. The handle makes all the difference. I had a mini stepper without a handle and never used it. So far I'm still using this one.
customer_reviews.author: BIO TREK

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: got this for home while the gyms are closed and it's been very helpful in keeping me on track with exercise. While it's just light movements. I do feel that it's toning my legs and the subtle twist has been helping tone my obliques. I use it along with doing other home-work outs and have been very satisfied. Also it's pretty small so for someone with not a lot of space, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: KGlo

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little guy
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick "up" of the heartrate - just 350 reps or 15 minutes. It don't hurt the ol' prostate like me bike seat - be sure you drive thru your heels on the downstroke - saves the knees in the long run. I paid a lot more than the lucky poster who got it for $70 but it's still worth it - just use it frequently. The long riser gives good leverage so you can slide it around at will.
customer_reviews.author: tomnet

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Received this product recently and it was well packaged. Grandson assembled it in 15 minutes, referring to directions only once. Not sure I could have done that! The unit takes up very little space so I'm using it on a corner between the living/dining area where I can view the TV if desired. Offers good resistance so I'm breathing pretty rapidly after 100 steps. Gave it 4 stars for compact design, performance and ease of assembly but I did noet sloppy welding of bars at the base, remembering reviews that complained of breakage. I'll update if anything happens, meanwhile I am more than happy for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: EarthMother

customer_reviews.title: Good if you are not too tall.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice choice if you have limited space. It was easy to put together. I would not recommend it if you are over 6 feet tall; my son found it awkward to use because of his height. I ended up giving this away because the stepping motion aggravated an old knee injury if I used this for more than ten minutes or so, even on low tension. This is not the fault of the machine. If you have issues going up and down stairs, this would probably not be the best device to use.
customer_reviews.author: BaMa

customer_reviews.title: I loved this stepper before it broke
customer_reviews.text: I loved this stepper before it broke. I had it only for a couple months.... Cheap product unfortunately! I cannot even return it because I am passed the returning period. It makes no sense. I don't weight over 200 pounds so I don't understand how come it broke. It is the second stepper from Sunny Twister that I buy that brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Health and fitness
customer_reviews.text: This machine is super easy to put together. It only took me about 15 minutes not long at extremely easy. I bought this because can't really go out to walk with my daughter's do i bought this for us to use. I'M EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH THIS AND I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE. My only problem is that it only holds up to 250lbs so my wife can't use it unfortunately but other than that i have no problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative for the gym/Stairmaster.  Good workout for your home!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy working out with step machines. When I belonged to a gym, it was easy, but one of those machines cost $1000+ (not to mention, they are way to big for my home. After looking at reviews on this site and others I decided to order it. It is exactly what I wanted. It gives a great workout, and you can tighten or relax the tension. It also has a little computer that shows your time, steps, etc. I was afraid that it wouldn't be very stable, but I put a yoga mat under this on hardwood floor without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: DJJA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tool that can fit in your closet and gives you a low impact workout - No more excuse!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot find an excuse not to exercise when the weather is too bad. It is so compact (I never use the hand bar and vertical post which I leave under my bed) that it can fit inside my closet. I can watch TV while using, and you get a good workout out of it. I wish that we could get an even tighter setting. I have tighten the resistance wheel to the max, and feel like over the years it has worn down and has lost its resistance. But still excellent and super compact for the price.
customer_reviews.author: gary robinson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STEPPER
customer_reviews.text: I'm so thankful I purchased this step machine! Now that we're all experiencing such difficulty with this COVD19, I needed to find a way to get my exercise. This is the best purchase I made and I LOVE IT! I'm a full figured woman, trying to lose weight and this stepper allows me to get the exercise in that I really need and I get to workout at my pace. I put on my music and just go on my stepper! how easy is that! An added plus is it's compact enough that it doesn't get in the way in my small apartment. Thank you folks for helping me to make a lifestyle change for the better!
customer_reviews.author: Tutu Y

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? Seriously, the perfect stepper - and no big whoop for space, move-ability, adjustment. Just heavy enough to be a real piece of equipment. The slightly angled feet are brilliant - and somehow, if used in different "poses", I think you can actually exercise nearly every muscle in your body that you want strengthened. SO happy I found this; no need to SIT while watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Paula D.

customer_reviews.title: Came missing parts required for assembly and use
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in box, undamaged and sealed properly. However when I opened it and was reviewing the instructions for assembly, I quickly realized it was missing numerous parts in order to assemble the stepper. It was as though someone forgot to put a box in it that had parts 1b, 1c, 3, 4, 8, 12, and 13. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: floydramone

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! It is easy to store in a corner and get out when I have a few minutes to excersize. It is easy to use while watching TV. It was easy to assemble although the instructions were rather vague and I had a couple of questions that needed clarification but their customer service answered right away.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lamoreaux

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I love the stepper- it’s sturdy and provides a good workout. This was my 3rd one since they usually only last 10-12 months. But they are inexpensive so I don’t mind. However this one only lasted under 2 months before the step broke off of the main platform.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: . I am trying to build back my legs after surgery. Light enough to set in front of the TV so I use it a lot but can be moved into a corner when company comes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed at all
customer_reviews.text: It was extremely hard to assemble. You are supposed to push wires through these large tubes and they keep getting hunched up in the middle. We had to find innovative ways of making sure the wires went all the way through. It was awful! The range of motion is extremely low. Barely goes above the ground at all. Would have liked it way more if the range was more. Also, there is no button to turn it off. We need to wait 4 minutes before it turns off on its own. So if somebody else needs to use it right after you, they can’t if they want to keep track of the stats.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with this product. Its smooth and I have it on the lightest tension and it's working out well. It is easy for me to maneuver around not to heavy and not to light. I would recommend this to a friend. The only bad thing was the price. I over paid on Amazon. Try and get it from another place if you can. I saw it cheaper at Walmart after my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: hope to increase leg strength
customer_reviews.text: Once I found all the parts (something happened in shipping and the box had been re tapped and a few parts put in a different box) it went together very easy. I haven't had it long enough to know results of workouts, but my purpose in buying is to increase and maintain leg strength due to arthritis. I tried it for a very minutes and it is low impact and adjustable for how high to lift your legs so am looking forward to working into this exercise.
customer_reviews.author: LANITA

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd Sunny Piece and I love Them Both!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given all the stars, but I did have one bolt that I couldn't get in. It worked out ok, tho. It was one of 5 and the rest all went in and the stepper is very secure without it. I also have the glidder by Sunny and they are both very hearty and solid. I have had such a good experience with both pieces, that I ordered the stationary bike, too. That should arrive Thursday, so my little sunroom gym will be complete. Now I am looking at the rower, but running out of room...
customer_reviews.author: Becky Sunner

customer_reviews.title: LCD COUNTER DOES NOT COUNT STEPS/CALORIES...STAYS AT "0"
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this machine. Yes, I had reservations because the price was so low, but the reviews seemed to be positive enough. Putting it togther was a bit rough, especially making sure to run the wires for the counter through the body of the machine. All of that work, and the counter doesn't even count my steps or calories. Huge dissappointment. Edit: A year later, the machine makes an ubearable squeaking sound. I have tried to oil it, but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: PhD Boss

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to hide away in a corner. The perfect little machine to replace real stairs and more practical than a treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great compact stepper
customer_reviews.text: I like how compact the stepper is and enjoy using it.. The assembly was easy but the instructions made it confusing. Day three the pulley squeaked the whole time I was on it.. If you buy this immediately buy the silicone based lubricant spray. I found this information after researching how to trouble shoot the squeaking on the Sunny Health & Fitness website. After applying the spray the squeaking was silent but not for long. The squeaking is not loud so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: LuvtoShop

customer_reviews.title: this little thing has done a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for about a week and before and during pregnancy I would use an actual stair mill at the gym but since having my son and not going to the gym, this little thing has done a pretty good job. I have even worn my son in a wrap on it. Works really well for the price. If it does break after a few months, it's cool bc honestly 60 bucks for an exercise machine I don't expect it to last years. But so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn

customer_reviews.title: Love this. It took 15 minutes to easily assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this. It took 15 minutes to easily assemble. I'm 5'7, 125 lbs and it works great. I'm a runner and this works fine for those rainy indoor day alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Exercise Machine
customer_reviews.text: Great Little Machine, it was easy to assemble and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Great present for mom
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my mom! She is in excellent condition! She needed a piece of equipment to use instead of her exercise bike which doesn’t require sit down hurting her back or behind. She loves this product and it does not take up too much space! She likes home equipment because when the weather is not ideal she does not have to go outside to get it an great workout. It is also more quiet than her bike!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: BEST thing I ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: Started working from home during the virus, and worried about my change in physical activity. I’m 63. Picked this stepper up A) good price B) wanted something simple. THIS IS PERFECT!!! Keeps me moving and hoping my butt will appreciate it too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worse customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been back and forth with customer service about the meter that keeps track of time. I am finding that it is about 3-5 minutes different than actual time. Customer service says that is they way it is supposed to operate. The instructions say nothing about it being different the actual time. I have taken pictures and given them everything that was asked of me. I would never buy another product from this company. I will use my egg timer and hopefully nothing else will break because they most likely will not do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I like this thing and I do use it often. It's hard to assemble but I think it's worth the price. It's not a traditional stair stepper though. The movement is awkward. It's like side to side. Also it hurts my knee. I don't have a particularly bad knee but sometimes it hurts and this thing makes it hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Umaru Doma

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Best workout for the price!!! This is super small and compact, so it doesn’t take up any space. It does not need to be plugged in anywhere, which is great. It’s quiet and gets the job done! There is a counter which is nice too. I love this little gem, especially since gyms are still closed by us. It is the perfect lightweight workout. I still work up a sweat from 20 minutes on this thing, which is just what I need. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle h.

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: My husband put it together pretty quickly. It works so far and I don't have the squeaking noise yet that many have complained about. Only time will tell how it holds up. I definitely feel the burn in my thighs. It really does have a small footprint, so it takes up very little space. I don't see any adjustments for raising or lowering the resistance, so that's the only thing I would add to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Took my boyfriend a few minutes only. I went ahead and tried it, did 30 minutes on it and it was great. I'm 5'0 and I weigh 116ibs. I found it comfortable. My boyfriend is 6'0 and about 220 and he found it fine as well. Im very happy with it as of now. It definitely worked up a sweat! And felt a workout on my legs as well which is nice. For being home this does what it need to do. Is convenient and I should have gotten one long time ago! I definitely say give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: vcam

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t last unless maybe you only weight 100 pounds
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted 3 1/2 weeks until the cable broke. So disappointed. I was really enjoying it. Will not recommend it because of this. I used it every day.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPHINE SHUE

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of home equipment, nice workout, good value
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and a space saver. Works pretty well. Gives a nice workout both cardio, thighs, stomach, and legs. If you have knee problems suggest you wear a brace or tape. It does make some squeaky noise once the friction from the workout begins to heat the tension rods but not overly loud and you could probably WD40 that if it's bothersome... doesn't bother me at the moment. Reasonably easy to assemble. Overall, a good piece of home equipment for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Broke a few weeks after I got it. I weigh 180lbs. This thing is a flimsy piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bergel

customer_reviews.title: Works great but is loud
customer_reviews.text: For the price and size cant beat it. Compact and light and easy to store when not in use. It does squek though. I have tried to isolate where the sound is coming from but cannot. Is annoying but I deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean R.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I believe this little stepper is worth the money. It is not super well made, and if you move it the cable can come loose from the wheel that makes the steps go up and down. But that is easily fixed by setting the steps just right then you can slip the cable back on the wheel. I am satisfied with this purchase. It isn't something I use all the time, just every now and then, so it suits my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easy to set up, perfect for my needs and getting some exercise in when I don’t want to go on a walk or to the gym. I’m 5’2” and the range of motion is perfect for me. My husband is 6’ and it’s not great for his longer legs.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline E Short

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't fallen apart on me yet!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm what you call a 'dabbler.' I flirt with committing to exercise once every couple of months. For this purpose, this machine is sturdy and hasn't failed me yet. I can't speak to what every-day use looks like, but it works for me when I get the 'I need to do some fitness' days.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Got two, both broke
customer_reviews.text: Ended up getting two of these. The first one broke after about three months when the cable serving as the rotary snapped. I let the company know and they sent a replacement two weeks later. After using that for a week, the cable snapped on that one, too. Really good stepper other than that, but that flaw in owning both devices for such a short period of time was really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for beginners and small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Great little stepper for beginners. My husband assembled it in about 15 minutes. Light enough to move from one room to another and small enough to fit in my coat closet. I am about 165 lbs and aim to simply burn calories to lose weight. First workout, I was sweating and breathing hard after a short time. Felt stable and gave a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: great item for the price, very simple, works well, takes up very little space and is hardly noticeable in the corner of my living room. The only thing I don't like so much is that the range of step is pretty small and it doesn't go straight up and down like a step, there's a little twist, which takes a bit of getting used to, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elle ~ Guy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and use it every day. Easy to assemble as the instructions are clear. I do have to place a towel under the front bar where the pulley is because metal shavings land on the silver bar and when I move it back to where it sits when not in use, some of the shavings have fallen onto our light colored carpet and stained it. It was hard getting the stain out, but most of it is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want something that lasts more than a month
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this stepper a much better review if it hadn’t broken after barely a month of normal use. The cable snapped during my workout today. I’m more than 100lbs under the weight limit so I’m going to chalk it up to it being a poorly made piece of junk. It’s also interesting to note that it’s nearly doubled in price since I purchased it a couple of months ago. Pandemic price increase, anyone? Now i’m stuck with a piece of crap that I can’t return because of the current situation and our stay at home orders.
customer_reviews.author: luca campello

customer_reviews.title: Display module broke
customer_reviews.text: Display module broke after a week, since the product worked well and I had my apple watch I can still keep measures. Tried contacting sunny customer care , no response after I provide them with all information.
customer_reviews.author: Anil Kumar

customer_reviews.title: like tiny little steps
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. There is no tension setting for the stepping. The range of motion for the step seems too small too, like tiny little steps. I don't feel like it truly works the muscle groups it should for a true stepping motion. The handle bar became loose and wobbly very easily after even little use. It is a very basic unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of exercise equipment @ reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Received this second week of May. Two weeks later can report excellent review. With my hip replacement surgery years ago, there is NO problem with the subtle twist motion. Easy to step on/off although I personally like a desk top nearby as my legs can be a bit fatigued after a workout. Good exercise, easy to move about, no noise - recommend this equipment at a reasonable price for home exercise.
customer_reviews.author: l. kahn

customer_reviews.title: The LCD monitor not working
customer_reviews.text: I put it together and went to use it the LCD monitor wasnt working. Called Amazon and they directed me to call the manufacturer. Called the maufacturer and instead of helping me they tell me I need to send an email. I sent an email and have heard nothing back. I am about ready to send it back if I keep getting the run around.
customer_reviews.author: Konita W.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Received this today so I have only used it a little but this was super easy to put together. I believe it took maybe 10 minutes if that. It seems really well made. I bought this to keep me moving while we have been sheltering in place and working at home for what looks like an extended period of time. This machine seems to be well made. For the price it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for a moderate-cost fitness device
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to try to slow down old age a little. It seems pretty good for the purpose and it's nice it doesn't take much floor space.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Geek

customer_reviews.title: Love This Brand!
customer_reviews.text: During quarantine, I was worried I would fall out of my exercise routine - and then I came across the Sunny Health and Fitness products and I feel they have changed my life. they are so reasonably priced and they get the job done. they are light and easy to move around for different exercise areas. So happy with all these products!
customer_reviews.author: Pedraza

customer_reviews.title: Screeches
customer_reviews.text: Product screeches after a month of daily use I’ve oiled it and followed the trouble shooting guide to no avail. It’s usable, but the sound drives you crazy after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: next to my power gym, my fav peice of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Looks easy, is easy, but you can still work up a burn a lot faster than you'd think. Feels sturdy & not too big to leave out & handy. Keep mine out where I can hop on and do 50 to 100 reps several times a day. Easy to assemble too!
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was fast and assembly was easy. It's lightweight and can easily be transferred from ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to tone my thighs and butt during the cold winter months. Shipping was fast and assembly was easy. It's lightweight and can easily be transferred from room to room. When not in use, it sits in a small corner of my living room. It's sturdy and quiet. I've only had it for a few days, but so far I love it! No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: ZM

customer_reviews.title: So glad I ordered this
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take up much room. put it in front of the tv and get a great work out! I came back from a terrible illness. I could hardly walk I started working out a little at a time... After 3 months Im walking up stairs It made a huge difference in rebuilding my knees hips and legs.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Byrum

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had even harder settings. It’s nice for the time being, but it takes me a while to feel any burn. I use resistance bands around my thighs to increase it..
customer_reviews.author: K. N.

customer_reviews.title: If you have knee and ankle problems like me, you can step half way or twist ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both - handle bar and no handle bar. The handle bar is suitable for people with balancing problem. The one without allows me to do rubber band stretching exercises. If you have knee and ankle problems like me, you can step half way or twist to reduce stress on knees. (just playing with it) Another way to reduce stress on knees is to step, rest, step. The hudraulic shock absorber won't kick in action until you increased the steps per second rate. Well design of both exercise machine. Thanks to the designig team.
customer_reviews.author: FatAlWonG

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Worked out on it for 20 minutes and really felt the burn. It's easy to set up, some of the bolts were in there tight but compared to other things, it was a lot less frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Carter

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It was easy for my husband to assemble and it holds up great. I'm 150lb and 5'8. I love that you can change the pressure/resistance. The counter is also really helpful in setting goals and keeping track of how many steps you've done.
customer_reviews.author: iLoveJordyn

customer_reviews.title: Helps me exercise more
customer_reviews.text: I know myself, and I know that I will not exercise unless it's accessible and easy. This definitely fulfills those parameters. I watch the news and use this way more consistently than I would ever go to the gym. It's not the most difficult workout but I am more healthy and exercising more than I ever would have before.
customer_reviews.author: Farris

customer_reviews.title: It's like walking up stairs and sliding slightly outward with each ...
customer_reviews.text: The way the steps slightly move outward as you step down force you into a weird stepping motion. Ultimately the motions hurt my knees. It's not a natural motion as if I were to walk up stairs. It's like walking up stairs and sliding slightly outward with each step up, putting and unnatural pressure on my knees. I eventually stopped using this shortly after I got it. I have no use for it because it's not beneficial. Disappointing product. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dinty

customer_reviews.title: Kicks my a**!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to assemble and I love it! I don’t have time or mo eh for a gym membership and this makes me dead! Definitely recommend is “cheap” and works great. It doesn’t make an eye sore because it’s not huge! I’m 21 and 100 lbs aka very weak and I can carry this. So it’s easy to put away and take out when you want to workout!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving
customer_reviews.text: Got this for movement during movie watching. I work in an office full-time and always siting, but I love watching movies. So, I didn't want to be sitting all the time. Easy to put together. Doesn't take must space and easy to move around in front of TV. I am 5-8 and 220 lbs. Holds my weight. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kat C

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Twist Stepper Step Machine w/Handle Bar and LCD Monitor - NO. 059
product_meta.description:
Sunny Health & Fitness's Twister Stepper with Handle Bar works your deep muscles without putting extreme pressure on your bones and joints The twist action of the Sunny Twist Stepper with Handle Bar will help tone your whole body specifically working your thighs and buttocks This adjustable stepper comes with attached handle bars to help keep you balanced The LCD computer keeps track of elapsed time calories burned and number of steps This is a great piece of equipment to add to your home gym or to get you started on your journey to better health

AMAZON.COM
Tone your buttocks and thighs and work your muscles deeply with the Twister Stepper from Sunny Health & Fitness. This workout machine's twist action helps tone buttock and thigh areas and allows you to work your muscles deeply without putting as much pressure on your joints and bones. The built-in handlebar and deluxe, non-slip footplates offer balance and stability for a safe workout.

 Designed to help you meet your individual fitness goals, the Twister Stepper includes a multi-function LCD computer that provides your time, calories, scan, and count. The machine accommodates users of different heights with adjustable stepping height. The Twister Stepper boasts heavy-duty steel construction and is easy to fit into any corner of your home or office thanks to its small 19 by 17-inch platform and 48-inch height.

 Features and specifications

 * Adjustable stepping height
 * Heavy duty steel construction
 * Handle bar for balance
 * Deluxe non-slip footplates
 * LCD computer
 * Functions: time, calories, scan, and count
 * Assembled dimensions: 19 by 17 by 48 inches (LxWxH)
 * Gross Weight: 28 pounds
feature_bullets: LCD MONITOR: Monitor displays your Time, Calories, Count, and Scan, you will be able to see your results to keep you motivated and on pace.
BALANCE: This stepper has Handle Bars to help keep you balanced while you step. Great for beginners who are new to the stepping world.
TWIST ACTION: Tone both your core and lower body while performing fun and effective stepping actions to work deep muscles without putting extreme pressure on bones and joints.
NON-SLIP PEDALS: Textured non-slip oversized foot pedals to ensure safety of your vigorous workouts.
CONSTRUCTION: Heavy-duty steel construction to stand the test of time, and the everyday use of intense workouts. Max Weight capacity 250 lbs.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
